original: Eriksson, Åke Henrik Bernhard, bankdirektör, Skövde, f. 19/1/06 i Horn, Skarab. k, av järnv:tj:man J. B. E. o. Anna Eriksson. G. 43 m. Valborg Andersson. Barn: Björn f. 44, Finn 46. — Realex. 24, korr :-stud.. bankkurs. Anst. i Skarab. Ensk. Bank A-B, kassör i Väring 25, bokhåll. i Skövde 27, kamr. o. kont:förest, i Moholm 31, h. Skövde sparb. kassör 32, kamrer 36, verkst. dir. 47. Led. av styr. f. Sv. ibankm:förb. Skarab :distr. 38-43, stadsrev. 39. Hobbies: bridge, tennis.
translated:
Eriksson, Åke Henrik Bernhard, bank director, born January 19, 1906 in Horn, Skaraborg County. His parents were J.B.E. and Anna Eriksson, who was a railway official. He married Valborg Andersson in 1943 and they had two children: Björn, born in 1944 and Finn, born in 1946. 

Åke attended Realskola and later studied accounting and banking. He worked at Skaraborgs Enskilda Bank AB and held various positions: cashier in Väring in 1925, bookkeeper in Skövde in 1927, assistant cashier and head of accounting in Moholm in 1931, cashier at the Savings Bank in Skövde in 1932, accountant in 1936, and managing director in 1947. 

He was a member of the board for the Swedish Bankers' Association in the Skaraborg district from 1938-1943 and also served as city auditor in 1939. His hobbies included playing bridge and tennis.

jobTitle.name: Assistant Cashier and Head of Accounting
